abilitygroupdescription.p: Represents book learning on a wide variety of fields through academic study.

abilitydescription.p: The character has studied the history of antique objects, furniture, vases, coins, maps, swords, etc. They can check to evaluate the worth and provenance of these objects. At higher levels they can, with difficulty, discern the nature of certain well-known eldritch objects.

Book keeping encompasses accounting and financial skills. Book keeping is used by merchants, clerks, and castellans, to manage finances. With this skill an character can examine the books of a business to get an idea of how the business operates, whether it is doing well or badly, how much debt is owed if any, where the money is coming from and going to, and so on.
Maths is the lingua franca of science. A basic understanding of maths is a prerequisite for many other abilities. It can be applied in a very large and diverse range of circumstances.
Alchemy is concerned with the creation of chemical substances, the creation of cures for various diseases, the creation of solvents (acids), liquid fire, dies, gunpowder, etc.
Two, as yet, unattained goals of alchemy are the transmutation of lead into gold, and the creation of an elixir of immortality.

leveldescription.p: If the character has the necessary ingredients they can check to manufacture acids, dyes, blackpowder, inks, petards, grenades, poultices etc. They can identify many chemical substances. In need they may be able to substitute some substances during creation to make solutions of lesser strength. Requires a Mortar and Pestle.
In addition the character can make lore checks regarding the chemical composition of solutions, metals etc and might be able to conjecture on their origins and purposes.

The character may call themselves an Apothecary, and can prepare poisons, laudanum, war-fire, foaming plaster, and medicines for certain diseases in addition to the abilities from first level. Requires Alchemical Equipement.

The character can prepare Alkahest (requires Bile of the White Worm), a Potion of Living Death (requires serpents venom), Tears of Lethe (requires Laudanum), Limaceous Grease (requires the ichor of a demon), Smoked snigglets (requires fresh swamp snigglets), Ignis Sacer (requires rye bread and a few weeks of time), or Spirits of Quickening.

abilitydescription.p: The alchemist makes a Grand Discovery!! (maybe).

tablerow.td: Untamed Brute. The characters brutish nature comes to the fore. FIXME
Poison Resistance, +5 to saves versus being poisoned.
Unexpected Discovery. Gain a level in alchemy.
Forbidden Knowledge. Gain 3x promotions in magic and 3x promotions in fine arts, lore or special skills (promotions cannot be used to gain more Grand Discoveries)
Transmutation. After years of practice you finally are able to transmute lead into gold. Unfortunately you can't work out how to repeat the process. Fortunatly you transmute a lot of lead.
Elixir of Life. The alchemist has somehow ceased their own aging.
Surprise Discovery. Choose a Grand Discovery.

abilitylevel.leveldescription: Roll once on the Grand Discovery table. If the character makes several Grand Discoveries and receives a duplicate result then they reroll (except for the Transmutation and Surprise Discovery results).
Roll on the Grand Discovery table with +1 to the result, otherwise interpret the results the same as the level I version of this skill.
Roll on the Grand Discovery table with +2 to the result, otherwise interpret the results the same as the level I version of this skill.

abilitydescription.p: An understanding of the law grants the character insight into the way society works. The practice of law invariably leads to the heart of industry and the seats of power. Characters may be able to discern the motive behind political machinations and they may be able to cite a legal precedent in order to compel or cease certain courses of events in a civilized society.

Law is the study of the laws of a particular society. The study of the laws of one society is not necessarilly applicable to another. When choosing the law ability the player must specify which legal system they are studying.

leveldescription.p: Good, but not professional, understanding of the law of some land. Usually, the characters homeland. Some understanding of the laws in surrounding regions.
Professional level understanding and possibly experience with the law in a region.

abilitydescription.p: History is the study of the events of the civilized peoples. Its study is both interesting and useful.

Physics involves the study of the natural laws of the universe, movement and energy. Its practioners usually make a clear deliniation between the study of physics and the study of the wyrd, unworldly and unnatural laws (possibly to protect themselves from pogroms and witch hunts). At higher levels physics also includes the study of celestial mechanics.

leveldescription.p: Some understanding of the relationship between energy and forces, e.g. gravity, motion, stress and heat.
Includes some understanding of Astronomy and Meterology.

abilitydescription.p: Earth science is the study of the earth, mining and minerals.

leveldescription.p: The character has a good understanding of mineralogy and can identify metals, common stone types, and common greographical structures. The character can read technical maps. Can be used to detect secret doors underground.
The character has a rudimentary understanding of civil engineering, load distribution, sapping, bridge or dam building, and so on.

The character has some knowledge of the flora and fauna of their homelands. They may identify many plants and may know about useful herbal remedies for certain diseases or for use in the the making of poultices. They have some understanding of zoology and anatomy.
The character has enough of an understanding of anatomy that they may attempt minor surgeries, set bones etc.
The character has extensive knowledge of diseases both common and exotic. They may diagnose many diseases, prepare poisons and medicines.

abilitydescription.p: This ability represents the study of the machinations that occur in the upper levels of power in society, its application, its history and its heraldry. This includes political theory: Real Politics and Machiavellian dealings and important historical treaties and maneveurings.

leveldescription.p: The character has knowledge of the history and current affairs of some local regions nobility and royalty. They know the heraldic insignias of these nobles and important state organizations. They understand the laws of succession in that region. They know most of the commonly known court intrigue.
The character has 1st level knowledge of two other regions and has deep knowledge of their own region. They may know some tightly kept secrets.

ability.abilitydescription: The study of religions, their belief systems, rituals and history.

leveldescription.p: The character has a vague understanding of religious philosophies, legends and lore.
The character has spent some time learning about religious philosophies, legends and lore. Can identify most religious symbols and quote from their texts.
The character has a deep knowledge of numerour religions both living and dead. The character depth of knowledge is deep enough that they may pass as a follower of many faiths when questioned.
Can enter a trance that releases stress, appears as if the character is dead and can reduce the characters oxygen consumption, and reduce the effect of poisonous miasmas.

abilitydescription.p: The character knows how to make magical potions given a lab, time and the right ingredients.
